items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible from the early hours of Friday 11 February into the early afternoon. In addition, there is a heightened risk from overtopping at Haddiscoe New Cut as the embankment level has been reduced. We have reduced our Flood Alert threshold and we are undertaking emergency repairs and planned future works to bring the embankment back up to condition. High water levels are expected through Friday due to the natural tide locking effect, associated with a coastal surge overnight on Thursday. We expect to see high water levels in Brundall and Reedham riverside areas. Take care and don’t put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation closely and do not expect the situation to escalate. We have issued this message early due to the heightened risk from overtopping at Haddiscoe New Cut. We will update this message by 2:00pm on Friday 11 February.

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible from the early hours of Friday 11 February into the early afternoon. In addition, there is a heightened risk from overtopping at Haddiscoe New Cut as the embankment level has been reduced. We have reduced our Flood Alert threshold and we are undertaking emergency repairs and planned future works to bring the embankment back up to condition. High water levels are expected through Friday due to the natural tide locking effect, associated with a coastal surge overnight on Thursday. We expect to see high water levels at Beccles Quay. Take care and don’t put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation closely and do not expect the situation to escalate. We have issued this message early due to the heightened risk from overtopping at Haddiscoe New Cut. We will update this message by 1:30pm on Friday 11 February.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: Due to rainfall overnight river levels are remaining high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water. Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. We expect levels to start to decrease this morning (09/02/2022) and continue to decrease until the weekend, when more rainfall is forecast. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue messages if necessary. This message will be updated as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.description: Middle River Mersey catchment including areas near Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston

floodArea.county: Cheshire East, Manchester, Salford, Stockport, Tameside, Trafford, Warrington

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Mersey due to rainfall overnight on Tuesday 08/02/2022 and into the morning of Wednesday 09/02/2022.  No further significant rainfall is currently forecast.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Mersey, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying land and roads around Micker, Cringle, Sinderland and Poynton Brooks and their tributaries.
Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around Micker, Cringle, Sinderland and Poynton Brooks and their tributaries from approximately 06:00 AM to approximately 06:00 PM on Wednesday 09/02/2022.
We will continue to monitor river levels closely.
You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
Due to planned maintenance to back end IT systems, this message cannot be further updated and will remain in force until the work completes by end of Thursday 10th February 2022.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
